snippet: The drug, to be called Sirturo, was discovered by scientists at Janssen, the pharmaceuticals unit of Johnson & Johnson, and is the first in a new class of drugs that aims to treat the drug-resistant strain of the disease.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration says it has approved Sirturo, new treatment for multidrug-resistant tuberculosis that can be used as alternative when other drugs fail; warns that drug, which belongs to an entirely new class of drugs, should be used only for patients who do not have other more tested treatment options available.
lead_paragraph: The drug, to be called Sirturo, was discovered by scientists at Janssen, the pharmaceuticals unit of Johnson & Johnson, and is the first in a new class of drugs that aims to treat the drug-resistant strain of the disease.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Approves Sirturo, a New Tuberculosis Drug
